channel.title: Mediagazer
channel.description: Top news and commentary for media professionals from all around the web

item.title: チキン・スープ・フォー・ザ・ソウル・エンターテインメントに売却された後、多くの支払いを停止し、いくつかの訴訟に直面しているRedboxの衰退を見てみよう（Janko Roettgers/Lowpass）。
item.description:
Janko Roettgers / Lowpass:
A look at Redbox's decline, as it faces several lawsuits after it stopped paying many bills around the time it sold to Chicken Soup for the Soul Entertainment  —  Chicken Soup in the hole … “We still exist.  Thanks for asking.” … These days, however, the word “still” is doing a lot of work.

item.title: Medium、AIが作成したストーリーを公開したライターや、その他の低品質なコンテンツを公開したライターからパートナープログラム登録を取り消すと発表（Buster Benson/The Medium Blog）
item.description:
Buster Benson / The Medium Blog:
Medium says it will revoke Partner Program enrollment from writers who publish AI-generated stories, even with disclosure, and other low-quality content  —  Protecting Medium's mission and authentic writers means doing more to protect quality  —  We know you've seen it: spammy comments that say nothing of value.

item.title: テネシー州、ミュージシャンやその他のアーティストをAIによる不正使用から保護することを目的とした「Ensuring Likeness Voice and Image Security（ELVIS）法」を可決（Kanishka Singh/Reuters）
item.description:
Kanishka Singh / Reuters:
Tennessee passes the Ensuring Likeness Voice and Image Security (ELVIS) Act, aiming to protect musicians and other artists from unauthorized use involving AI  —  Tennessee Governor Bill Lee signed a bill into law on Thursday that aimed to protect artists including musicians from unauthorized use by artificial intelligence.

item.title: Xは、ネオナチと疑われる漫画家の正体を暴いたアカウントを停止した後、方針を転換し、匿名アカウントの背後にいる人物の実名掲載を禁止した（David Ingram/NBC News）
item.description:
David Ingram / NBC News:
Changing policy, X bans the posting of real names of people behind anonymous accounts, after it suspended accounts that unmasked a suspected neo-Nazi cartoonist  —  Some X users said the move was another example of Musk going out of his way to defend neo-Nazis, antisemites and white supremacists.

item.title: FCCがネクスターとミッション・ブロードキャスティングに180万ドル以上の罰金、ニューヨークのテレビ局WPIXの運営で米所有権規則違反の疑い、ネクスターは上訴予定（Jon Lafayette/Next TV）
item.description:
Jon Lafayette / Next TV:
The FCC fines Nexstar and Mission Broadcasting $1.8M+, alleging violation of US ownership rules in operating New York TV station WPIX; Nexstar plans to appeal  —  Regulator rules that Nexstar committed ‘willful and repeated’ violations of ownership rules, also fines Mission Broadcasting $612,395

item.title: Mozilla財団と90以上の研究・擁護団体がMetaに対し、選挙の誤報を世界規模で追跡するCrowdTangleを2025年1月まで支援するよう要請（Karissa Bell/Engadget）
item.description:
Karissa Bell / Engadget:
The Mozilla Foundation and 90+ research and advocacy groups urge Meta to support CrowdTangle through January 2025 to track election misinformation globally  —  The letter, also signed by CrowdTangle's former CEO, claims shutting it down is a “direct threat” to researchers' work

item.title: 2002年以来、米国の各州は映画奨励プログラムに250億ドル以上を支出しているが、独立した専門家によれば、このプログラムはせいぜい損益分岐点であるとの調査結果（ニューヨーク・タイムズ）。
item.description:
New York Times:
A survey finds US states have distributed over $25B to film incentive programs since 2002, but independent experts find the programs are break-even at best  —  Dozens of states have lured film and TV production with financial incentives.  Years after gutting its program during a budget crisis, Michigan wants to rejoin the arms race.

item.title: iSpotやVideoAmpのような企業は、視聴者測定プロトコルの変化に取り組む中で、ニールセンの視聴率支配にどのように挑戦しようとしているのか（Brian Steinberg/Variety）
item.description:
Brian Steinberg / Variety:
How companies like iSpot and VideoAmp are trying to challenge Nielsen's ratings dominance, as the industry grapples with changing audience measurement protocols  —  The day after the Super Bowl typically brings with it another kind of celebration: Nielsen's annual announcement of the size of the audience for the NFL extravaganza.

item.title: ジュリア・アングウィンは、プルーフ・ニュースが調査報道のために「科学的手法」を用いることを目指し、技術分野にとどまらず、企業の説明責任などをカバーするために拡大することを目指していると語っている（Neel Dhanesha/Nieman Lab）。
item.description:
Neel Dhanesha / Nieman Lab:
Julia Angwin says Proof News aims to use “the scientific method” for investigative journalism, and expand beyond tech to cover corporate accountability, more  —  The cofounder of The Markup wants to expand beyond tech with her new publication.  —  At the end of February …

item.title: 英国は、外国国家や政府関係者が新聞社に直接出資することを禁止する新法を提案し、UAEが支援するテレグラフ社への入札を危機にさらす（Jane Croft/The Guardian）
item.description:
Jane Croft / The Guardian:
The UK proposes a new law banning foreign states and officials from holding direct stakes in newspapers, putting the UAE-backed bid for the Telegraph at risk  —  Proposed law unveiled on Thursday bans foreign states and government officials from holding direct stakes in newspapers

item.title: 2023年10月に入社したKotakuのジェン・グレノンEICが辞任、経営陣がガイドを優先してニュースを優先しないという最近の決定を手紙の中で理由に挙げている（余波）
item.description:
Aftermath:
Kotaku EIC Jen Glennon, who joined in October 2023, resigns, citing in a letter the management team's recent decision to deprioritize news in favor of guides  —  Jen Glennon, who took over as editor in chief of Kotaku in October, resigned Thursday.  In a resignation letter seen by Aftermath …

item.title: スポティファイがTikTokのようなデザインに変更し、トップポッドキャスターのフォロワー数が明らかになった：ジョー・ローガン・エクスペリエンスのフォロワー数は14.5M、次いでTED Talks Dailyの5M（Ashley Carman/Bloomberg）
item.description:
Ashley Carman / Bloomberg:
Spotify's TikTok-like redesign reveals the follower numbers for top podcasters: The Joe Rogan Experience has 14.5M, followed by TED Talks Daily with 5M  —  A new TikTok-like redesign from the streaming giant unveils actual audience data for top podcasters  —  Welcome back to Soundbite.

item.title: ラッセル・ブランドに対する性的暴行・不品行疑惑をスタッフが知っていたことを示唆する「証拠はない」とチャンネル4が内部調査を発表（Etan Vlessing/The Hollywood Reporter）
item.description:
Etan Vlessing / The Hollywood Reporter:
Channel 4 says its internal investigation found “no evidence” to suggest its staff knew of sexual assault and misconduct allegations against Russell Brand  —  The British network that helped drive Brand's early fame, after an internal probe, did conclude a former employee made a …

item.title: レディット、ニューヨーク証券取引所デビューで終値は48％高の1株50.44ドル、完全希薄化ベースの企業価値は約95億ドル（ブルームバーグ）
item.description:
Bloomberg:
Reddit closes up 48%, at $50.44 per share, in its New York Stock Exchange debut, valuing the company at about $9.5B on a fully diluted basis  —  - Social media company, holders raised $748 Million in IPO … The San Francisco-based company's stock closed at $50.44 each on Thursday in New York …

item.title: Audacyがポッドキャスト部門をAudacy Podcastsに改称、Cadence13と2400Sportsのブランドを売却し、コンテンツとスタッフをAudacy Podcastsに移す（Caitlin Huston/Hollywood Reporter）
item.description:
Caitlin Huston / Hollywood Reporter:
Audacy rebrands its podcast division as Audacy Podcasts, sunsets Cadence13 and 2400Sports brands, and moves their content and staff to Audacy Podcasts  —  There are no layoffs as part of the move, nor any changes to the content slates. … As part of the move, the company will be sunsetting …
